page.title: 16FARMING
page.content: The major source of employment in this area is farming. By far the most dominant type of farming is hill- farming. It is only on the valley floor and in well-sheltered areas that any arable farming can take place. On these hill farms there tend to be two main parts to the farm. (a) In-by. This area consists of the farm buildings and fields which are fenced and/or walled. Hay is often an important crop. It is here where the farmer will try to keep his less-hardy stock, especially in severe winter weather. (b) Out-by. This area tends to consist of open unfenced moorland. Stock can roam over a wide area. Shepherds use horses to help them check their flocks. The major land-owner in this area is The Duke of Northumberland.
